newsitem.title: DENMARK: Danish bonds slip amid dearth of fundamentals.
newsitem.headline: Danish bonds slip amid dearth of fundamentals.

text.p: Danish bond prices were largely static on Wednesday morning, with no new data due during the trading day to give the market a push.

At 0710 GMT the benchmark eight percent state bond due 2006 traded at 112.00, yielding 6.17 percent, unchanged from Tuesday afternoon. The seven percent 2007 bond slipped 0.06 point to 104.61 yielding 6.37 percent.
The crown eased to 3.8073 to the mark from Tuesday's 3.8068.
The 2006 yield gap with Germany narrowed to 44 basis points from Tuesday's 45 bp, and the 2007 gap to the bund also narrowed one, to 64 bp.
The 2006's September future fell 0.14 point to 111.10 but the six percent mortgage bond due 2026 rose 0.25 to 90.40. Steve Weizman, Copenhagen newsroom +45-33-969650
